title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt & David Thomas
description: A practical guide to programming best practices, software craftsmanship, and continuous learning.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship, focusing on writing clean, maintainable code.

title: Refactoring
author: Martin Fowler
description: A guide to improving the design of existing code through incremental refactoring techniques.

title: Design Patterns
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
description: The foundational book on reusable object-oriented software design patterns.

title: The Mythical Man-Month
author: Frederick P. Brooks Jr.
description: A collection of essays on software project management, highlighting the complexities of large-scale development.

title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
author: Michael Sipser
description: A rigorous but accessible introduction to automata, formal languages, and computational complexity.

title: You Don't Know JS: Scope & Closures
author: Kyle Simpson
description: Deep dive into JavaScript's scope and closure mechanisms, essential for understanding modern JS.

title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
author: Harold Abelson & Gerald Jay Sussman
description: A classic MIT textbook on fundamental programming concepts using Lisp.

title: Deep Learning
author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville
description: A comprehensive introduction to deep learning, covering theory, practice, and applications.

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
author: Stuart Russell & Peter Norvig
description: The go-to textbook for AI fundamentals, covering search algorithms, machine learning, and reasoning.
